Name: An example of using the #window hash command.
Description: This set of commands will create a new window, set it's title and status as well as echo text and colored text to it.
Author: Rhien

AliasList.Command: #example;#window -n ExampleWindow --title "Example Window" --status "This is where a custom status could go";#echo -w ExampleWindow "{xRhien says '{gYou can you the normal mud {Rc{Yo{Gl{Wo{Cr{g codes you know and love here.{x';#echo -w ExampleWindow "{xRhien says '{gHello, how are you?  Here, have a toaster.{x'";#echo -w ExampleWindow "Rhien hands you a broken toaster.";#echo -w ExampleWindow "Rhien now points to the line below this one, it will be prefixed with a timestamp.";#echo -w ExampleWindow -d "There is a timestamp on this line.";
